intro: Cordylanthus nevinii, commonly known as the Nevin's grass vetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has small, compound leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
